subject: Investing
title: World Stock Market Returns by Decade
description: A fast breakdown of World Stock Market Returns by Decade for builders.

hook.text: The top-performing market by decade: Japan in the 80s, Europe in the 2000s, the US in the 2010s. Pattern? No pattern.

buildup.text: Market leadership rotates unpredictably. The decade's winner often becomes the next decade's underperformer.

discovery.text: From 2000-2009, the S&P 500 returned -1% while emerging markets returned +154%. Nobody predicted that.

twist.text: Chasing last decade's winner is a classic mistake. By the time leadership is obvious, the premium is gone.

climax.text: Global diversification is the honest answer to an unknowable question: which region will win next?

punchline.text: You can't predict the winning region. You can own them all.

quiz.question: What pattern do top-performing markets show across decades?
